data.name: DLG_Activity_Core_DescriptionFormatOverwritePossible
data.value: NOTE: The description for this activity may contain special formatting which will be lost if the description is modified and the activity is saved. Detecting special formatting...

data.name: DLG_Activity_Core_DescriptionFormatOverwriteDefinite
data.value: WARNING: The description for this activity contains special formatting which will be lost if the description is modified and the activity is saved!

data.name: MSG_TEXT_DescriptionFormatOverwriteMessage
data.value: The description for this activity has been modified. Since the original description contained special formatting which the dialog cannot preserve, saving the activity will cause the original formattting to be overwritten. Are you sure you want to save the activity?

data.name: DLG_ActivityCategory_HelpText
data.value: To assign Color Categories to the currently selected items, use the checkboxes next to each category. To edit a category, select the category name and use the commands to the right.

data.name: MSG_TEXT_DuplicateCategoryName
data.value: You already created a category called '{0}'. Please select another category name.

data.name: MSG_TEXT_DeleteCategory
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete the category '{0}'? Deleting this category removes it from your category list but does not affect your previously categorized items.

data.name: MSG_TEXT_RenameCategory
data.value:
Are you sure you want to rename category '{0}' to '{1}'?
Renaming this category changes its name in the master list as well as in the current activity, but does not change the name assigned to other activities (if any) that were previously categorized. Those activities will retain the old name, and also lose the color association.

data.name: MSG_TEXT_CantEditResource
data.value: The owning resource for the selected activities cannot be edited at this time. Certain functions will be disabled.

data.name: DLG_Recurrence_MonthlyPattern_Literal_ComplexTextField2
data.comment: Unused in english

data.name: DLG_Recurrence_MonthlyPattern_Complex_ElementOrder
data.comment: A comma separated list of numbers that refer to the elements in the complex section of the Monthly Recurrence Pattern. This list determines the order in which the elements are arranged left to right.

data.name: DLG_Recurrence_MonthlyPattern_Simple_ElementOrder
data.comment: A comma separated list of numbers that refer to the elements in the simple section of the Monthly Recurrence Pattern. This list determines the order in which the elements are arranged left to right.

data.name: DLG_Recurrence_YearlyPattern_Literal_SimpleTextField
data.comment: Unused in english

data.name: DLG_Recurrence_YearlyPattern_Simple_ElementOrder
data.comment: A comma separated list of numbers that refer to the elements in the simple section of the Yearly Recurrence Pattern. This list determines the order in which the elements are arranged left to right.

data.name: DLG_Recurrence_YearlyPattern_Literal_ComplexTextField2
data.comment: Unused in english

data.name: DLG_Recurrence_YearlyPattern_Literal_ComplexTextField6
data.comment: Unused in english

data.name: DLG_Recurrence_YearlyPattern_Complex_ElementOrder
data.comment: A comma separated list of numbers that refer to the elements in the complex section of the Yearly Recurrence Pattern. This list determines the order in which the elements are arranged left to right.

data.name: DLG_Recurrence_ShouldShowRecurrenceDescription
data.comment: 'true' for English translations, 'false' for other languages. Once the Recurrence description has been made localizable, this string will be removed and appropriate localizable description part strings will be added.

data.value: The specified date '{0}' is outside the allowed range ({1}-{2}).

data.name: LE_MissingMappings
data.value: Property mappings have not been specified for {0}.

data.name: LE_TZProviderMissing
data.value: No time zone info provider found. Set the {0}.{1} property.

data.name: LE_NoLOcalTimeZones
data.value: Local time-zone can not be ascertained. Set {0}.{1}.{2} to a valid time zone id.

data.name: LE_NoUTCTimeZone
data.value: UTC time-zone information can not be ascertained. Set {0}.{1} to a CustomTimeZoneInfoProvider with its {2} set to the UTC id.

data.name: LE_NoUTCTimeZone_OS
data.value: UTC time-zone information can not be ascertained. TimeZoneInfo.Utc.Id returned a value of '{0}' which was not found in the collection returned from TimeZoneInfo.GetSystemTimeZones().

data.name: LE_NoEndPointConfig
data.value: Cannot connect to a WCF service. Either the endpoint configuration or the remote binding and address must specified. Set the {0}.{1} to a valid endpoint configuration or set {0}.{2} and {0}.{3} to a valid remote binding and address.

data.name: LE_NotConnectedToService
data.value: The {0} is not connected to a WCF service.

data.name: LE_LinQSerializeFailure
data.value: Could not serialize the LINQ statement for the service call.

data.name: LE_CantCreateObject
data.value: Unable to create {0} object. Public parameterless constructor is required and type must be public as well.

data.name: LE_AddNotSupportedByList
data.value: Add is not supported by list.

data.name: LE_AddNotSupportedByDataSource
data.value: Underlying data source {0} list doesn't support add operations.

data.name: LE_IListNotImplemented
data.value: {0} Data source list does not implement IList<T> or IList necessary to support adding and removing.

data.name: LE_AddOperationFailed
data.value: Underlying data source list for {0} failed to perform add operation.

data.name: LE_MissingMapping
data.value: {1} property mapping must be specified for {0} datasource".

data.name: LE_NoDataItemForViewItem
data.value: The {0} view item doesn't have an underlying data item and thus can't be removed from the data source.

data.name: LE_MustImplementLinq
data.value: Derived list manager for {0} needs to override CreateLinqStatement method."

data.name: LE_CanNotDelete
data.value: Cannot delete occurrence because either it's already in edit mode or cannot be modified.

data.name: LE_RootActivityNotFound
data.value: The activity's series is not found.

data.name: LE_RootActivityNotFound_Full
data.value: The variant activity's root activity reference is not initialized. This can typically occur because the MaxOccurrenceDataTime of the root activity was not updated to reflect change in the End time of the variant activity to a value greater than the MaxOccurrenceDateTime. Also this error can occur if Start of a variant activity was changed to a value before the Start of the root activity.

data.name: LE_CanNotUpdateSeries_Full
data.value: Unable to update the variant activity's root activity. MaxOccurrenceDateTime property needs to be updated to reflect the new time of the variant activity. MaxOccurrenceDateTime must be a value that's greater than or equal to the greatest end time of any of the occurrences of the series.

data.name: LE_MustBeAfterSeries
data.value: An occurrence's Start time cannot be changed to be earlier than the series start time.

data.name: LE_AppConfigError
data.value: Application configuration error. The functionality is not supported.

data.name: LE_MissingMappingHeader
data.value: The following property mappings are missing for {0} items:

data.name: LE_RequiredMappingHeader
LE_InvalidDayOfWeekRule
data.value: Has invalid relative day of week rule. It's only valid in a monthly or yearly rule or frequency.

data.value: '{0}' time-zone id is invalid. No time-zone with the specified id exists.

data.name: LE_ActivityHasInvalidTZ
data.value: Activity with the id of '{0}' has an invalid time-zone id value of '{1}'. No time-zone with the specified id exists.

data.value: Unable to convert {0} value to target type {1}

data.value: Unspecified error. Cancel edit operation failed.

data.value: Specified activity is not a cloned activity that was returned from BeginEditWithCopy call.

data.value: {0}.DataConnector was not set. No activities or calendars will be displayed.

data.value: {0}.CurrentUserId was not set. Reminders will not be displayed.

data.name: LE_CanNotAddANullItem
data.value: Can not add a null item.

data.value: At least one date range must be specified.

data.name: LE_QuerySealed
data.value: An ActivityQuery cannot be modified after it has been executed.

data.name: LE_CanNotInitCancelledOp
data.value: Can't initialize result of a canceled operation.

data.name: LE_CanNotCancelCompletedOp
data.value: A completed operation can not be canceled.

data.value: Working hours must be within the span of 24 hours.

data.value: Must call BeginUpdate before calling EndUpdate.

data.name: LE_TokenNotFromProvier

data.value: Can't access object from a different thread.

data.value: '{0}' as specified in property mapping doesn't exist as a direct property of the item type of the data source list for {1}. Is the data source a generic list with the correct template type?

data.name: LE_NoVisibleCalendars
data.value: {0} contains no visible calendars. Either set the {0}.DataManager.CurrentUserID to a ResourceID with a PrimaryCalendar or add CalendarGroups, containing visible ResourceCalendars, to the {0}.DataManager.CalendarGroups collection or the {0}.CalendarGroupsOverride collection.

data.name: LE_InvalidRemoteAddressType
data.value: The {0}.{1} property must be set to a string, Uri, or EndpointAddress.

data.name: LE_CannotFindDataItemOnServer
data.value: The backing data item is no longer present on the server.

data.name: LE_MissingMappingRecurrence
data.value: In order to support recurring activities, the 'Recurrence' field is required.

data.name: LE_MissingMappingVariance
data.value: In order to support variances (modifications to occurrence of a recurring activity), the following fields are required.

data.name: LE_MissingMappingTimeZoneNeutral
data.value: In order to support time-zone neutral activities, 'IsTimeZoneNeutral' field is required.

data.value: In order to support reminders, the following fields are required.

data.value: 'End' field is required in order to support end-times for activities.

data.name: LE_MissingMapping
data.value: {1} field is required in order to support {0} feature for activities.

data.value: The remote service cannot be reached.

data.value: A template part with a name of '{0}' and type '{1}' is required in the '{2}' template.

data.value: {0} is not a member of the supported views collection

data.value: The task '{0}' is set to recur in the future. Do you want to delete all future occurrences of the task or just this occurrence?

data.value: Choose the type of activity to create.

data.name: LE_InvalidCategoryColor
data.value: The activity category named '{0}' has a color which is not supported.

data.name: LE_InvalidWorkingHourEnd
data.value: The end time must be after the start time.

data.name: RD_RecurrenceDescriptionOverallStructure
data.comment: Where: {0} is the 'frequency' part and is replaced with a string like 'daily' or 'monthly' or 'every 2 days' or 'every 3 months' {1} is the 'rules' part and is replaced with (potentially) zero or more complex strings like: 'on Monday and Wednesday' and/or 'on the 12th and 13th days of the month' and/or 'the 1st monday of the month' {2} is the 'effective' part and is replaced with a string like: 'effective 12/15/2015' or 'effective 12/15/2015 until 12/29/2015' 'effective 12/15/2015 until 12/29/2015 from 18:00 to 18:30'

data.name: RD_Every
data.comment:
Where: {0} is replaced with a string like '2' or '5' {1} is replaced with a string like 'days' or 'months' or 'hours' or it could be empty
Examples: every 5 days every 15 weeks every 10 hours

data.name: RD_Effective1
data.comment:
Where: {0} is replaced with a start date for the recurrence
Example: effective 11/06/15

data.name: RD_Effective2
data.comment:
Where: {0} is replaced with a start date for the recurrence {1} is replaced with an end date for the recurrence or it could be empty if there is no end date
Example: effective 11/06/15 until 12/06/15

data.name: RD_Effective3
data.comment:
Where: {0} is replaced with a start date for the recurrence {1} is replaced with a start time for the recurrence or empty if there are no times associated with the recurrence {2} is replaced with an end time for the recurrence or empty if there are no times associated with the recurrence
Example: effective 11/06/15 from 08:00am to 09:00am

data.name: RD_Effective4
data.comment:
Where: {0} is replaced with a start date for the recurrence {1} is replaced with a start time for the recurrence or empty if there are no times associated with the recurrence
Example: effective 11/06/15 at 08:00am

data.name: RD_Effective5
data.comment:
Where: {0} is replaced with a start date for the recurrence {1} is replaced with an end date for the recurrence or it could be empty if there is no end date {2} is replaced with a start time for the recurrence or empty if there are no times associated with the recurrence
Example: effective 11/06/15 until 12/06/15 at 08:00am

data.name: RD_Effective6
data.comment:
Where: {0} is replaced with a start date for the recurrence {1} is replaced with an end date for the recurrence or it could be empty if there is no end date {2} is replaced with a start time for the recurrence or empty if there are no times associated with the recurrence {3} is replaced with an end time for the recurrence or empty if there are no times associated with the recurrence
Example: effective 11/06/15 to 12/06/15 from 08:00am to 09:00am

data.name: RD_RepeatingOneTime
data.comment:
Where: {0} is replaced with the number of repetitions, e.g. '3' or '5'
Example: repeating once

data.name: RD_RepeatingMultipleTimes
data.comment:
Where: {0} is replaced with the number of repetitions, e.g. '3' or '5'
Example: repeating 3 times

data.name: RD_OnThe
data.comment:
Used to create strings like 'on the 35th and 36th'.
Example: on the 35th and 36th days of the year

data.name: RD_OnEach
data.comment: Used to create strings like 'on each Wednesday and Thursday'.

data.name: RD_WeekOrDayOfTheMonthOrYear
data.comment: Where: {0} is replaced with the string 'day' or 'week' from the resource string RD_FrequencyLiterals {1} is replaced with the resource string RD_OfTheMonthOrYear

data.name: RD_OfTheMonthOrYear
data.comment:
Where: {0} is replaced with the string 'month' or 'year' from the resource string RD_FrequencyLiterals
Examples: of the month of the year

data.name: RD_InMonth
data.comment:
Where: {0} is replaced with a month name
Example: in June

data.name: RD_RulesInMonth
data.comment:
Where: {0} is replaced with a string that describes one or more day or week rules {1} is replaced with the resource string RD_InMonth
Example: on the 2nd day of the month in June

data.name: RD_AtTime
data.comment:
Where: {0} is replaced with a time of day (HH:MM:SS)
Example: at 8:00am

data.name: RD_OnEverySecond
data.comment: Where 'second' refers to a unit of time (as in hour-minute-second)

data.name: RD_OnTheNthSecond
data.comment:
Where: {0} is replaced with the resource string 'RD_OrdinalNumberWithSuffix'
Example: on the 5th second

data.name: RD_OfEveryMinuteOrHour
data.comment:
Where: {0} is replaced with 'minute' or 'hour' from the resource string RD_FrequencyLiterals
Examples: of every minute of every hour

data.name: RD_OfTheNthMinuteOrHour
data.comment:
Where: {0} is replaced with the resource string 'RD_OrdinalNumberWithSuffix' {1} is replaced with 'minute' or 'hour' from the resource string RD_FrequencyLiterals
Examples: of the 5th minute of the 10th hour

data.name: RD_OrdinalNumberWithSuffix
data.comment:
{0} is replaced with an ordinal number e.g. '3' or '25' {1} is replaced with a string suffix for the ordinal number from one of the following resource strings: RD_NumberSuffix_th, RD_NumberSuffix_st, RD_NumberSuffix_nd, RD_NumberSuffix_rd
Examples: 1st 2nd 3rd 4th

data.name: RD_NumberSuffix_th
data.comment: Used as a suffix for certain numbers when specifying an ordinal position, e.g. '5th'.

data.name: RD_NumberSuffix_st
data.comment: Used as a suffix for certain numbers when specifying an ordinal position, e.g. '1st'.

data.name: RD_NumberSuffix_nd
data.comment: Used as a suffix for certain numbers when specifying an ordinal position, e.g. '2nd'.

data.name: RD_NumberSuffix_rd
data.comment: Used as a suffix for certain numbers when specifying an ordinal position, e.g. '3rd'.

data.name: RD_OrdinalDayOfMonthUsesSuffix
data.comment:
Where: 'true' causes an ordinal suffix to be generated when creating a 'day of month' rule description 'false' does not cause an ordinal suffix to be generated when creating 'day of month' rule description
Examples: When set to 'true': Nth day of month When set to 'false': N day of month

data.name: RD_Last
data.comment: Used to specify that a date entity is the last one, e.g. 'last Wednesday of the month'.

data.name: RD_ToTheLast
data.comment: Used to specify the position of a date entity with respect to the last possible position, e.g. '2nd to the last Wednesday of the month'.

data.name: RD_FrequencyLiterals
data.comment: An ordered and comma separated list of literals that correspond to this list of english literals: year,month,week,day,hour,minute,second

data.name: RD_FrequencyLiterals2
data.comment: An ordered and comma separated list of literals that correspond to this list of english literals: yearly,monthly,weekly,daily,hourly,minutely,secondly

data.name: RD_FrequencyLiteralsPlural
data.comment: An ordered and comma separated list of literals that correspond to this list of english literals: years,months,weeks,days,hours,minutes,seconds

data.name: RD_And
data.comment: Like the english word 'and' for joining all adjacent elements, e.g. 'Monday and Tuesday'.

data.name: RD_Or
data.comment: Like the english word 'or' for joining one of the adjacent elements, e.g. 'Monday or Tuesday'.

data.name: RD_Weekday
data.comment: Refers to the days from Monday thru Friday'.

data.name: RD_WeekendDay
data.comment: Refers to Saturday and Sunday.

data.name: RD_OccurrenceOfThe
data.comment: Refers to create strings like 'Occurs on the 2nd occurrence of the 1st Wednesday of the month'.
